1. ATAC-seq data preprocessing¶

Process scATAC-seq data (or bulk ATAC-seq data) to get open accessible promoter/enhancer DNA sequence. If you have a scATAC-seq data, proximal and distal cis-regulatory elements from TSS site can be picked up using Cicero . If you have bulk ATAC-seq data, open accessible DNA elements around TSS site will be picked up.

A. Extract TF binding information from scATAC-seq data¶

If you want to use scATAC-seq data, you can start from Cicero analysis to get information of distal cis-regulatory elements. This step use Cicero and do not use celloracle. Please refer to the documentation of Cicero for the detailed usage.

R notebook

  • 0. Import library
  • 1. Prepare data
  • 2. Load data and make Cell Data Set (CDS) object
    • 2.1. Process data to make CDS object
  • 3. Qauality check and Filtering
  • 4. Process cicero-CDS object
  • 5. Run cicero to get cis-regulatory connection scores
  • 6. Save results for next step

Next, the results of Cicero analysis will be processed with celloracle to make TSS annotations.

Python notebook

  • 0. Import libraries
  • 1. Load data made with cicero
  • 2. Make TSS annotation
  • 3. Integrate TSS info and cicero connections
  • 4. Filter peaks
  • 5. Save data

B. Extract TF binding information from bulk ATAC-seq data or Chip-seq data¶

Instead of scATAC-seq data bulk DNA-seq data can be used.

  • 0. Import libraries
  • 1. Load bed file
  • 2. Make TSS annotation
  • 3. Save data
